tool_list_1.name: Bitnation
tool_list_1.description: Collaborative platform for voluntary self-governance powered by bitcoin 2.0 blockchain technology. Deployed applications include blockchain based passport, land deed, and marriage systems.

tool_list_3.name: CitySourced
tool_list_3.description: CitySourced is a real time mobile civic engagement platform. CitySourced provides a free, simple, and intuitive platform empowering residents to identify civic issues (public safety, quality of life, & environmental issues, etc.) and report them to city hall for quick resolution; an opportunity for government to use technology to save time & money plus improve accountability to those they govern; and a positive, collaborative platform for real action.

tool_list_4.name: CKAN Open Data Portal
tool_list_4.description: Open source data portal software used by numerous governments, organisations, and communities around the world.

tool_list_5.name: Councilmatic
tool_list_5.description: Search, browse, subscribe and comment on your City Council bills, council members and events.

tool_list_6.name: DemocracyOS
tool_list_6.description: DemocracyOS is an online space for deliberation and voting on political proposals. It is a platform for a more open and participatory government.The software aims to stimulate better arguments and come to better rulings, as peers.

tool_list_7.name: Front Porch Forum
tool_list_7.description: Front Porch Forum is software platform for hosting regional networks of online neighborhood forums. More than 100,000 members in Vermont.

tool_list_8.name: Github
tool_list_8.description: Powerful collaboration, code review, code management, open source and private project management.

tool_list_9.name: Holacracy
tool_list_9.description: Holacracy is a social technology or system of organizational governance in which authority and decision-making are distributed throughout a holarchy of self-organizing teams rather than being vested in a management hierarchy. Holacracy is a new way of running an organization that removes power from a management hierarchy and distributes it across clear roles, which can then be executed autonomously, without a micromanaging boss. The work is actually more structured than in a conventional company, just differently so. With Holacracy, there is a clear set of rules and processes for how a team breaks up its work, and defines its roles with clear responsibilities and expectations.

tool_list_10.name: LiquidFeedback
tool_list_10.description:
LiquidFeedback is an open-source software, 
powering internet platforms for 
proposition development and decision making. Developed in Germany.

tool_list_11.name: Long Distance Voter
tool_list_11.description:
Long Distance Voter will help you register to vote or get an absentee ballot online. We work aggressively to build and leverage technology to remove barriers to voting. Long Distance Voter launched in 2008 as an information-based site for absentee voters. 

The site now covers all aspects of voting, from registering to vote, to voting-by-mail, to voting early, to answering questions about what ID to bring to the polls. LongDistanceVoter.org is the most-visited site for accurate voting information.

With the gutting of the Voting Rights Act, attacks on early voting hours and Election Day registration, and the passage of restrictive voter ID laws, Long Distance Voter's services are more essential than ever. We're building a small team of technology experts to deliver best-in-class solutions to mounting democratic problems. We won't rest until every who wants to vote can easily cast a ballot.

tool_list_12.name: Loomio
tool_list_12.description: Loomio is a collaborative decision-making tool that makes it easy for anyone to participate in decisions which affect them

tool_list_13.name: Neighbor.ly
tool_list_13.description:
Neighborly curates public works investment opportunities creating an easier and more personalized way to make public investments.
Be neighborly by investing in your community through public projects like parks, education, and other civic infrastructure.

tool_list_14.name: Neighborland
tool_list_14.description: ﻿Our software empowers civic leaders to collaborate with residents in an accessible, participatory, and enjoyable way. We provide real-world design tools and a powerfully simple platform to engage people on the web. We have worked with hundreds of civic organizations in the United States, including city agencies, universities, foundations, and local non-profits.

tool_list_15.name: Open Town Hall
tool_list_15.description: Peak Democracy Inc's Open Town Hall is a cloud-based online civic engagement platform that augments and diversifies public participation in ways that also enable government leaders to increase public trust in their governance.

tool_list_16.name: OurSay
tool_list_16.description: OurSay is a gamified question & answer online platform geared to engage young people 13+ in shaping the political conversation. Created in  Australia.

tool_list_17.name: PlaceSpeak
tool_list_17.description: PlaceSpeak is a location-based consultation utility. Share your insights on local issues directly with city officials and other decision makers to help solve communal challenges and launch new initiatives. We’re passionate about citizen-powered change and already have thousands of civically minded individuals engaging with hundreds of organisations.

tool_list_18.name: SeeClickFix
tool_list_18.description: SeeClickFix allows you to play an integral role in public services — routing neighborhood concerns like potholes and light outages to the right official with the right information.
tool_list_18.license: Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States License

tool_list_19.name: Socrata Open Data Portal
tool_list_19.description: The Socrata Open Data Portal™ simplifies data movement by making it easy to upload, query, analyze, visualize, and share.

tool_list_20.name: Stellar
tool_list_20.description: Stellar is a technology that enables money to move directly between people, companies and financial institutions as easily as email. We’re building a common financial platform, designed to be open and accessible to everyone. This means more access for individuals, lower costs for banks, and more revenue for businesses. Help better the world’s financial infrastructure by participating in our community or by building on Stellar.

tool_list_21.name: Nextdoor
tool_list_21.description: The private social network for your neighborhood.

tool_list_22.name: Backfeed
tool_list_22.description: Backfeed provides the infrastructure and toolkits that build on the emerging blockchain ecosystem. Backfeed  make it possible for people to easily deploy and maintain decentralized applications and organizations that rely on the spontaneous and voluntary contribution of hundreds, thousands or millions of people.

tool_list_23.name: IdeaScale
tool_list_23.description: IdeaScale is an innovation management platform that uses crowdsourcing to help you find and develop the next big thing.

tool_list_24.name: Audience Engine
tool_list_24.description: Open-source suite of community-building, fundraising and publishing tools for radio stations and other content producers.

tool_list_25.name: Civinomics
tool_list_25.description: Set up an online poll for your city, school, company or group

tool_list_26.name: Brigade
tool_list_26.description: Brigade is the first app that lets you discover which of your friends support you, and on what issues.

tool_list_27.name: GlassFrog
tool_list_27.description: GlassFrog is a cloud-based software tool that makes Holacracy transparent and accessible, end-to-end.

tool_list_28.name: Crowdpac
tool_list_28.description: Find candidates matching your priorities. Our data shows where they stand on the issues, based on what they say, how they vote and who gives them money.

tool_list_29.name: coUrbanize
tool_list_29.description: coUrbanize helps communities, municipalities, and real estate developers build better cities together.

tool_list_30.name: MetroQuest
tool_list_30.description: MetroQuest is used to broaden and enrich public engagement for planning projects. It is the software of choice for leading planning, engineering, architecture and public involvement firms and agencies.

tool_list_31.name: Swarm
tool_list_31.description: A decentralized crowdfunding platform that allows companies to sell cryptographic shares easily and quickly by creating their own digital currencies.
